unnormalised: **Automotive News: Understanding the Latest Vehicle Launches in India**
normalised: **Automotive News: Understanding the Latest Vehicle Launches in India**

unnormalised: New car launches in India are constantly evolving, driven by consumer demand and technological advancements. This month saw exciting introductions from Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors.
normalised: New car launches in India are constantly evolving, driven by consumer demand and technological advancements. This month saw exciting introductions from Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki launched its much-anticipated new compact SUV, the "Pavana," boasting a fuel efficiency of 28 kmpl. Priced starting at Rs. 7.99 Lakh, it features a BS-VI compliant engine and advanced safety features developed with input from IIT Madras.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki launched its much-anticipated new compact S U V, the "Pavana," boasting a fuel efficiency of twenty eight kilometer per liter. Priced starting at rupee seven lakh ninety nine thousand, it features a B S dash V I compliant engine and advanced safety features developed with input from I I T Madras.

unnormalised: Tata Motors unveiled its all-electric sedan, the "Vidyut," targeting eco-conscious buyers. With a claimed range of 450 km on a single charge, it aims to address range anxiety. Dr. Sharma from ARAI highlighted the importance of rigorous testing for EV batteries to ensure optimal performance in Indian conditions.
normalised: Tata Motors unveiled its all-electric sedan, the "Vidyut," targeting eco-conscious buyers. With a claimed range of four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge, it aims to address range anxiety. Doctor Sharma from A R A I highlighted the importance of rigorous testing for E V batteries to ensure optimal performance in Indian conditions.

unnormalised: Experts say understanding features like ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) and connected car technology is crucial for consumers. These launches showcase the industry's commitment to innovation and meeting the diverse needs of the Indian market, from affordable petrol cars to advanced electric vehicles. Dealerships are expanding their showrooms to accommodate these new models, with some adding dedicated EV charging stations and displays spanning thousands of sq ft. Stay tuned for our in-depth review next week!
